intro: Malvastrum tricuspidatum var. capitatospicatum, commonly known as the clustered thimbleweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. The leaves are palmately lobed, and the plant is often found in clusters, giving it its common name.
